list_definition.definition: to clean (a thing or person, especially oneself) with (soap and) water or other liquid

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: How often do you wash your hair?
You wash (the dishes) and I’ll dry
We can wash in the stream.

list_definition.definition: to be able to be washed without being damaged

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: This fabric doesn’t wash very well.

list_definition.definition: to sweep (away etc) by means of water

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The floods have washed away hundreds of houses.
He’s just gone to have a wash.

list_definition.mean_english: nhứng thứ có thể gíặt được
list_definition.definition: things to be washed or being washed

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: Your sweater is in the wash.

list_definition.definition: the flowing or lapping (of waves etc)

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: the wash of waves against the rocks.

list_definition.definition: a liquid with which something is washed
a thin coat (of water-colour/-color paint etc), especially in a painting

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The background of the picture was a pale blue wash.

list_definition.definition: the waves caused by a moving boat etc

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The rowing boat was tossing about in the wash from the ship’s propellers.

list_ex_of_english: I couldn't get washed, dressed or eat until my husband came home at night.
